Seven, y=
akuza connections with the ultranationalists began 
more "openly" in the 18=
90s with the changing face of political 
parties during the Meiji era.  Yak=
uza today still are considered to 
be right wing conservatives and use thei=
r money to support political 
candidates.

Rei Shinoda was asking about the=
 *Bakumatsu era, during which the 
yakuza had flourished (they were also do=
ing very well much earlier).

 lore, goes way back in

d common ground in very high

sted at http://www.shinsengumihq.com/misc_facts.htm

ns of the Aizu-Kotetsu gang which traced its

st leader Senkichi in 1836. "Isao

red brand/type of sword of the boss." (Seymour 70-72)

again, I'm sure Seym=
our who had heard this lore from a member of the 
yakuza cannot guarantee i=
ts accuracy.  As I mentioned in my post, 
there were practical reasons why =

uza which in fact did run the

rea).  Yakuza families
